intro: Bonplandia resinosa, commonly known as the resinous bonplandia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. Its unique feature is the production of a sticky, aromatic resin, which has been used traditionally by indigenous communities. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests.
